detaileddescription.para: Embed header into MPDU and return pointer to the header. The MPDU contained at this pointer is in proper order specified by IEEE 802.11 and ready to be transmitted.
Embed tail into MPDU and return point to the tail which contains the proper byte-order FCS.

Return the current value of address.
index
which address to query.
address as a vector of 6 numbers.
Get pointer to the MPDU's data.
Returns the size of MPDU's frame body.
Return value of Duration field.

Return value of From_DS field.
From_DS value.
Get pointer to the MPDU's header. The frame contained at the returned pointer is already in proper byte-order specified by IEEE 802.11, and therefore, is ready to be transmitted.
Returns the size of MPDU's header.
Return value of Sequence Control field.
Get pointer to the MPDU's tail.

Return value of To_DS field.
To_DS value.
Returns frame type.
Returns frame subtype.

Returns value of Duration field.
bytes
receive bytes
Returns Frame Control field.

Parse header from a received array of bytes whose order is specified by IEEE 802.11.
recv
received bytes.
len
number of bytes of received MAC frame.
true if checksum is correct, false otherwise.

Parse header from a received array of bytes whose order is specified by IEEE 802.11.
recv
received bytes.
len
number of bytes of received MAC frame.
info
MAC frame information.
true if checksum is correct, false otherwise.

Parse management frame from received bytes (lowest-order byte first).
recv
received bytes.
len
number of bytes.

Parse management beacon frame from received bytes (lowest-order byte first).

received bytes.
len
number of bytes.

received bytes.
len

Put data of a given size into the payload at a given position.
data
contains the user data.
len
size of the data chunk to put in.
where_to_put
where in the payload to put data in.
Reset FCS part.
Return MPDU as a sequence of bytes in correct order specified by IEEE 802.11. The returned sequence is ready to embed into PHY layer.

Set MAC address fields. See IEEE80211-8.2.4.3.
index
which address to set. Currently only 3 addresses are supported. To specify which address, use MAC_ADDR1, MAC_ADDR2, or MAC_ADDR3.
addr
contains 6 number elements of the address, each should have value between 0-255.

Set MAC address from a string type address.
index
which address to set. Currently only 3 addresses are supported. To specify which address, use MAC_ADDR1, MAC_ADDR2, or MAC_ADDR3.
addr
address in format "xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx".

Set MAC frame's body.
data
user data.
len
data size in bytes.

Prepare MPDU buffer to contain the data with given size.
len
size of the data.

Set Duration field.
duration
value of Duration field.

Set Sequence Control field.
seq
value of Sequence Control field.

Set To_DS and From_DS fields. See IEEE80211-8.2.4.1.4.
toDS
value of To_DS (0 or 1).
fromDS
value of From_DS (0 or 1).

Set frame type and subtype.
type
frame type.
subtype
frame subtype.

Update the tail part of the MPDU with new user data appending to the body.
data
data appending to the body.
len
size of the data.
the pointer to the MPDU tail part.
